info.title: CustomerAPI
info.description:
This is the public API for managing customer related data.

**Security**

In order to use this api, you'll need multipe headers:
- Tilroy-Api-Key: The api key of the tenant, so that we know what data you are allowed to manage
- x-api-key: The api key of AWS, so that we know, what you are allowed to do (access specific endpoints or specific throttling rules)
- Authorization: The bearer token of the customer, so that we know if you are allowed of retrieving/updating data of a specific customer

If you are developping an app where the customer needs to update his/her own data, you can use the AuthenticationAPI to get a token for the customer by using the /tokens endpoint.

If you are writing a service for syncing customer data, we will need to provide you a bearer token with access to allow retrieving/updating the data of all customers.

When you get an error **'User xxx has no permission to update customer'** you are probably using a wrong combination of headers. 
Both the Tilroy-Api-Key and the the bearer token should be linked to the same tenant. 
This can happen when you have multiple tenants for each environment you are integrating with.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to look up customers by email, googleid and facebookid

post.description: This endpoint should be used for creating new customers
This endpoint should be used to merge customers
This endpoint should be used to merge customers history

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve all the information of a customer

put.description: This endpoint is for updating an exisitng customer

delete.description: This endpoint is for deleting an exisitng customer

get.summary: Retrieve all addresses of a customer
get.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve all addresses of a customer. Depending on the returned properties, it wil be clear what is the main address and what addresses to use for billing and delivery.

post.description: This endpoint is for creating a new customer address

get.summary: Retrieve single addresses of a customer
get.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve a single addresses of a customer. Depending on the returned properties, it wil be clear if it is the main address or the addresses to use for billing and delivery.

put.description: This endpoint is for updating an exisitng customer address

delete.description: This endpoint is for deleting a customer address. (The main address cannot be deleted!)

get.summary: Retrieve single address of a customer by type
get.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve a single address of a customer by type: main, billing or delivery

put.summary: Set address of a customer to a type
put.description: This endpoint can be used to set a single address of a customer as the default billing or delivery address

delete.description: This endpoint can be used to unset an address of a customer as the default billing or delivery address. The default billing/delivery address will become the main address.

get.summary: Retrieve all cards of a customer
get.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve all cards of a customer.

post.summary: add a card to a customer
post.description: This endpoint can be used to create a card for customer.

get.summary: Retrieve all groups of a customer
get.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve all groups of a customer.

post.summary: Add a group to a customer
post.description: This endpoint can be used to add an extra group to a customer, or replace the main group.

delete.summary: remove a group from a customer
delete.description: This endpoint can be used to remove a group of a customer. The main group cannot be removed

get.summary: Retrieve all interests of a customer
get.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve all interests of a customer.

put.summary: update an interests of a customer
put.description: This endpoint can be used (un)check an interest of a customer.

get.summary: retrieve customers updated since a certain date
get.description: This endpoint can be used to export all customer data.

get.summary: retrieve deleted customers updated since a certain date
get.description: This endpoint can be used to export all deleted customer data.

post.description:
Use this endpoint for updating the newsletter notification of a customer
When a customer wants to subscribe for newsletter notification, use this endpoint with the hash sent in the email to the customer

delete.description:
Use this endpoint for updating the newsletter notification of a customer
When a customer wants to unsubscribe for newsletter notification, use this endpoint with the hash sent in the email to the customer

post.description:
Not a free endpoint! Use this endpoint for validation of emailadresses
The results contains the orginal value, if it was valid or not, a score on how certain it is valid, and finally a suggestion 'didYouMean' containing a possible better value

Use this endpoint for validation of phonenumbers
The results contains the orginal value, if it was valid or not, a score on how certain it is valid, and finally a suggestion 'didYouMean' containing a possible better value

get.summary: find one or more contacts of a customers

delete.description: Calling this endpoint will update the active flag to false and set the dateDeleted to the current date and time.

post.summary: switch the main contact of a customer
post.description: Calling this endpoint will swictch the main contact of a customer, and copy the properties from the contact to the customer.

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Bearer access token for getting/updating customer details (https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/bearer-authentication/)

customerIdToKeep.name: customerIdToKeep
customerIdToKeep.description: the tilroyId of the customer that should be kept

queryFields.name: fields
queryFields.description: Comma-separated list of all fields you want returned in the result. All other fields will be omitted.

queryDateFrom.name: dateFrom
queryDateFrom.description: filter results by the date the item was created for export (Deprecated, use dateExportedSince)

queryDateExportedSince.name: dateExportedSince
queryDateExportedSince.description: filter results by the date the item was created for export

queryCount.name: count
queryCount.description: max number of items to be returned (default = 10, max = 100)

queryHash.name: hash
queryHash.description: a unique string identifying a customer

queryPage.name: page
queryPage.description: page of results to be returned (default = 1)

queryCards.name: cards
queryCards.description: customer cards you want to fetch on

queryAllowDeleted.name: allowDeleted
queryAllowDeleted.description: allow deleted documents to be shown

checkEmail.description: whether or not the customer should be asked the next time if the email is correct

review.description: should the customer receive a review email, when buying a product

checkEmail.description: whether or not the customer should be asked the next time if the email is correct

review.description: should the customer receive a review email, when buying a product

code.description: Gender code - 4 options, 'C' can be used for 'Company'

isDefault.description: if this group is the customers default or extra CustomerGroup

Company.description: company info of the customer. Can be set to null when updating the customer.

code.description: represents string representation of status code

message.description: contains information on resource not found

mainAddress.description: this value is required when trying to add a new main address, otherwise the first address in the array will be implied as an update to the main address
Whether this is the main address for the customer

defaultBillingAddress.description: Whether this is the default billing address for the customer

defaultDeliveryAddress.description: Whether this is the default delivery address for the customer

checked.description: whether or not a customer is interested in the topic

countryCode.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (defaults to BE)
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (defaults to BE)

EmailValidationResult.description: contains the result of validating an emailaddress

didYouMean.description: A suggestion to use if miss-typed the domain name

PhonenumberValidationResult.description: contains the result of validating a phonenumber

didYouMean.description: A suggestion to use: the phonenumber formatted as national number

VatValidationResult.description: contains the result of validating a VAT number

didYouMean.description: A suggestion to use: the vat number formatted

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

MergeBody.description: contains the information of the customers to be merged with the main customer

CustomerContactCreate.description: The CustomerContact JSON in the body of the request or response

CustomerContactUpdate.description: The CustomerContact JSON in the body of the request or response

CustomerMainContactSwitch.description: The Main CustomerContact JSON in the body of the request or response

CardCreateResult.description: The result of the card creation

X-Paging-ItemsPerPage.description: number of max items returned per page.

X-Paging-ItemCount.description: total number of items over all pages.

Link-JSON.description: JSON version of the Link header.

TilroyApiKey.description: The API key to identify the tenant
TilroyApiKey.name: Tilroy-Api-Key

XApiKey.description: The API key of AWS to identify who is performing the requests
XApiKey.name: x-api-key

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description: Bearer access token for getting/updating customer details (https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/bearer-authentication/)
